  physical_appearance: This is a keris with a gold-coated sheath. The keris has a narrow
 straight black blade
 with stylistic pamor patterns
 and gold decoratives of a dragon added near the handle. A small part of the handle has added carvings. The sheath has a wooden frame
 coated in gold
 carved with floral motifs and adorned with diamonds.

  sgcool_label_text: The extraordinary quality of this keris can be seen in both the valuable materials and high level of craftsmanship used to make it. Such keris were not for ordinary people but only for people of direct royal descent. \r\n\r\nKeris were an important dress accessory and status symbol
 as well as a weapon and also were regarded as powerful objects of supernatural protection. The keris was thought to contain a spirit or isi which if properly cared for would ward off both physical and magical injury.

metadata.physical_appearance: This is a keris with a gold-coated sheath. The keris has a narrow, straight black blade, with stylistic pamor patterns, and gold decoratives of a dragon added near the handle. A small part of the handle has added carvings. The sheath has a wooden frame, coated in gold, carved with floral motifs and adorned with diamonds.
metadata.subject_terms_2: Motifs ceremonial objects Javanese (Indonesian people) Daggers
metadata.sgcool_label_text:
The extraordinary quality of this keris can be seen in both the valuable materials and high level of craftsmanship used to make it. Such keris were not for ordinary people but only for people of direct royal descent. 

Keris were an important dress accessory and status symbol, as well as a weapon and also were regarded as powerful objects of supernatural protection. The keris was thought to contain a spirit or isi which if properly cared for would ward off both physical and magical injury.
